composite_rules: Overall score = weighted sum of 7 PSC criteria scores (each 0-100)
Criteria weights: fluency 20%, comprehension 15%, vocabulary 15%, grammar 15%, interaction 15%, pronunciation 10%, logical_connectors 10%
Level assignment based on overall score thresholds: A (36-54), B (55-74), C (75-100)
Sustained performance: learner must score at a level in 70%+ of last 5 sessions to be assigned that level
No single criterion can be more than 1 level below the others (e.g., cannot be C overall with A grammar)
If any criterion is at X level (below A threshold), overall level is capped at A regardless of other scores
Session score is rolling average: new_avg = (old_avg * (n-1) + new_score) / n
Level C requires all 7 criteria at B+ minimum
Exam simulation mode uses stricter thresholds: A=40-59, B=60-79, C=80-100
Interaction and logical_connectors are cross-cutting competencies evaluated throughout the entire interview
